title: Directorates of the Scottish Government
text:
The work of the <a href="Scottish%20Government">Scottish Government</a> is carried out by Directorates, each headed by a Director. The Directorates are grouped into a number of Directorates-General families, each headed by a Director-General. However, the individual Directorates are the building blocks of the system. The Directorates are further broken down into "Divisions" and then by teams. Divisions usually consist of 25-50 people. There is no direct correspondence between the political responsibilities of the <a href="Minister%20%28government%29">Ministers</a> in the Scottish Government and the Directorates, although in some cases there is considerable overlap. The Directorates are also responsible for a number of government agencies and <a href="non-departmental%20public%20bodies">non-departmental public bodies</a>. Some government work is also carried out by <a href="Executive%20agencies%20of%20the%20Scottish%20Government">Executive Agencies</a> such as <a href="Transport%20Scotland">Transport Scotland</a>, who sit outside the Directorates structure, but are also staffed by <a href="Civil%20Service%20%28United%20Kingdom%29">civil servants</a>
The current system of Directorates was created by a December 2010 re-organisation. Prior to 2007 the Directorates were preceded by similar structures called "Departments" that no longer exist (although the word is still sometimes used in this context).
The <a href="Office%20of%20the%20Permanent%20Secretary%20%28Scotland%29">Office of the Permanent Secretary</a> is headed by the <a href="Permanent%20Secretary">Permanent Secretary</a> Leslie Evans, who replaced Sir <a href="Peter%20Housden">Peter Housden</a>, in July 2015. The current structure of the directorates is given below.
Communities.
Director-General, Paul Johnston
Constitution and External Affairs.
Director-General, Ken Thomson
Corporate.
Director-General, Lesley Fraser
Economy.
Director-General, Liz Ditchburn
Education and Justice.
Director-General, Joe Griffin
Exchequer.
Director-General, Alyson Stafford
Health and Social Care.
Director-General and Chief Executive of NHS Scotland, Caroline Lamb
Directorates.
Note: In the September 2011 civil service reorganisation, three Directorates were combined. These were: the Cabinet, Strategy and Performance, and International and Constitution.
